page.title: 20THE YORKSHIRE DIALECT
page.content: The largest English county has a store of special words with roots deep in the past.These are derived mainly from Northumbrian,an Old English dialect spoken in England north of the Humber. Yorkshire is the home of "Tykes" and "Yorkshire as it's spokken" is alive in many parts of the country. Examples- Addle-earn,Ammot-am not,Apiece-each 'appen-perhaps,At-who(m),Baht-without, Back'ards-rooad-backwards,Blether-talk nonsense,Brass-money,Brig-bridge,By gum-good gracious,Canny- well thought of,Champion-excellent,Chuffed-pleased, Don-put on,Flummoxed-bewildered,Fowks- people,Gammy-injured,Gumption-common sense,Jowl-knock,Kindlin-firewood, Learn-teach,Mash-brew,Middlin-moderate Nark-annoy,Nobbut-only,Nowt-nothing, Owt-anything,Parky-chilly,Sen-self, Summat-something,Think on-remember.
